frame.name: Condition_symptom_relation
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Patient</fen> has a <fen>Medical_condition</fen> that can be understood by its <fen>Symptom</fen>s. This frame has been constructed to list all the ways to speak of relating a <fen>Patient</fen>, a <fen>Medical_condition</fen>, and <fen>Symptom</fen>s, including LUs that are also related to much more general frames like Causation (e.g. cause.v).
<ex> <fex name="Medical_condition">Neurally mediated syncope</fex> is the<fex name="Frequency">the most common</fex> <t>cause</t> of <fex name="Symptom">syncope</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Medical_condition">Tietze Syndrome and Costochondritis Tietze syndrome</fex> <t>manifested</t> <fex name="Symptom">by painful swelling of one or more costochondral articulations</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Patient
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person who has a <fen>Medical_condition</fen> associated with <fen>Symptom</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Patient">Premenopausal women</fex> often will <t>present</t> with atypical bleeding between typical menstrual cycles.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medical_condition
FE.definition: <def-root>A holistic description of the medical state of the <fen>Patient</fen> (or a part of the state of the <fen>Patient</fen>), which may or may not indicate the cause of a deviation from normal.</def-root>

FE.name: Symptom
FE.definition: <def-root>A deviation from normal function or feeling which is noticed by a <fen>Patient</fen> or physician, indicating the presence of a <fen>Medical_condition</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Group
FE.definition: <def-root>Specific type of people in which a <fen>Medical_condition</fen> is normally found</def-root>

FE.name: Extent
FE.definition: <def-root>The degree to which a <fen>Medical_condition</fen> is associated with a <fen>Symptom</fen>(s).</def-root>

lexUnit.name: manifest.n
lexUnit.definition: waarin kort en duidelijk de opvattingen van een partij of persoon staan
